meanings.sent1: He gudgeoned his friend by promising a gift but never delivering.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist gudgeoned innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sly fox gudgeoned the chickens into thinking he was their friend.
meanings.sent4: Her smile gudgeoned him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's smooth talk gudgeoned the old lady into giving him her life savings.

meanings.definition: To use flattery or charm to manipulate someone
meanings.sent1: She gudgeoned her way into getting a promotion by complimenting her boss.
meanings.sent2: The salesman gudgeoned the customer into buying a more expensive product.
meanings.sent3: The magician gudgeoned the audience with his charming tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her sweet words gudgeoned him into doing her bidding.
meanings.sent5: The politician gudgeoned the voters with promises he never intended to keep.

meanings.definition: A small freshwater fish of the minnow family, often used as bait in fishing
meanings.sent1: The gudgeoned wriggled on the hook, enticing the fish to bite.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen use gudgeoned as bait to catch larger fish.
meanings.sent3: The hungry trout eagerly went after the gudgeoned on the line.
meanings.sent4: The shimmering scales of the gudgeoned caught the sunlight as it swam.
meanings.sent5: The angler carefully placed the gudgeoned on the hook, hoping for a big catch.
